reasoning: The transcription provides a sequence of actions taken by Jacques Pepin to create a smoked salmon pizza using lavash bread. The steps are extracted based on the order of actions described, starting with preparing the bread base, cooking it, cooling it down, and then topping it with various ingredients before presenting the final dish.
dish_description: The dish is a smoked salmon pizza made with a base of artisan flatbread lavash, topped with whipped cream cheese, smoked salmon, red onion, capers, olives, and cilantro, finished with a drizzle of olive oil.

cooking_steps.description: Place a pan with a bit of olive oil on the heat and add the lavash bread to the pan, ensuring it fits properly.
Flip the lavash bread to cook on the other side.
Cut the lavash bread if necessary to make it fit the pan.
Bake the lavash in the oven at 400 degrees Fahrenheit for about 10 minutes.
Remove the cooked lavash from the oven and let it cool off completely before proceeding with the toppings.
Spread about a cup of whipped cream cheese evenly over the cooled lavash.
Add 4 ounces of smoked salmon, covering the cream cheese layer.
Thinly slice approximately half a cup of red onion and scatter it over the salmon.
Add capers and a mix of green and black olives to the pizza.
Drizzle a little bit of olive oil over the toppings.
Finish by adding fresh cilantro on top of the pizza.
Optionally, cut the pizza into slices before serving to make it easier to eat.
Present the beautiful smoked salmon pizza and enjoy.
